column4: I'll explain my self.....I want to execute "ls /bin".....I written a text file (testing.txt) that contains the line "/bin". tried two version of the same command: "ls < testing.txt" "less testing.txt | ls" non worked, why?
er, without the . at the end.
Also http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/ if you are going to be doing bash programming.
